cvnc_shPyzF_aBe2e05bzA.text: Great cup off coffee.  Just arrived in Scotland this morning, on two hours of sleep and need all the caffeine I can get.  Very friendly staff as well.

XhD7gB-fdmzXQqg41RdlHg.text: Wonderful wee coffee shop that embodies everything I love about Scotland...stone walls, slate floors, functional plaid seating and tons of reclaimed wood. This place has a really cosy and warm feel. Congrats to whoever designed the space I just love it. The staff are so kind and are welcoming...they'll let you sit and work while leisurely enjoying your drink or baked good. There's good banter and not to mention compliments from the staff too. Really honest and sincere baristas! Have only been to a few coffee places in Edinburgh as I normally make my own, but out of those this is the best. The coffee, tea, and scones are also wonderful. I had a triple shot flat white which was wonderfully prepared and presented in a lovely blue cup. I got a fruit-based tea called Cloud catcher and this came wonderfully presented also on a tray with the teapot, cup, and an adorable little hourglass to help time steeping. The sultana scone was again most well served with two artisanal clay pots of Graham's butter and what I believe was Bonne Maman Strawberry Jam. The scone was melt-in your mouth biscuit of British deliciousness. I could spend the rest of my life studying in the corner of this shop with my laptop (and yes free wifi!) watching the locals and tourists go in and out as I contemplate the meaning of life. Can't thank my barber, Luke at Sink & Anchor enough for recommending this coffee shop! Best thing that happened to my boring WASP life.

gHt3uuZ4x5BXMK8Igy3l2w.text: Great espresso and really friendly staff. Small but really good atmosphere and decor. And did I say great espresso?

y55YWu-8viEucDuUkrbvCw.text: e visited this cafe on Saturday,it looked friendly so we went in . Unfortunately this wasn't our experience ..at best the three staff were uninterested and at worst rude. The coffee  and scones were good ( coffee was very small) but my daughter asked if they had any sweetner to which the reply was just No ! Then they carried on chatting amongst themselves ..I think we were disturbing them and also the rugby he was either watching or listening too. Our cups and plates were whisked away without asking if we had finished ( my daughter hadn't ) and we felt they wanted us to leave. Which we gladly did . Shame really as it could be a nice cafe .

2q3AvpAR-B_mzOpXw3LNBA.text: What a charming little coffee shop in the middle of all the hubbub. The seating is not much, but when I came it was not crowded. The barista was friendly and made our drinks perfectly. She even brought it to where we chose to sit! She was knowledgeable and answered any questions customers had. The coffee was excellent too.

Cqb774dxChHDLxO3vXGgag.text: Incredible coffee! This place is the real deal. Definitely one of the best lattes I've ever had. The place has a really cool vibe with stone interior. Also has comfy seats and places to plug in your devices to charge up.

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Milkman Coffee &amp; Espresso Bar

pHcab1DhdQreJBMr4KoarQ.text: We stopped in at this super cute cafe on our way to Edinburgh Castle. It was lovely to get away from the large groups of visitors walking up the royal mile while enjoying some great coffees and pastries.   This small cafe has a very nice atmosphere that feels inviting and cool without being to hipster-y. The barista was very welcoming and worked quickly to serve everyone in a timely manner.   We got two drinks, a simple latte and a mocha, both were very good and the flavor of the blend was very pleasing. The mocha did not taste like a simple hot chocolate as so many other places' mochas normally do. We also had two pastries, a chocolate croissant and and an almond croissant. Both were light and buttery, and the chocolate was nice and rich.   I will definitely be stopping in again next time I'm in Edinburgh!

fp5_riIx6CCXyiJYZCPOQQ.text: I like it...im just not sure how its going work especially through winter and let me tell you why.  With seating for maybe 5 people and no other standing room your only other hope is then really to be a takeaway coffee shop but there isn't really the service space for that and the ordering/collecting point are side by side so there's no place for a queue to form and feed through to.  The coffee is nice, my flat white was pretty good. The roast is subtle so for me as a flat white is lacked a bit of a kick. We went for the lemon drizzle cake, GF which is nice. The bake was dense and not as light & crumbly as I would like. The cake had peel baked it which was bitter, quite nice.   If you're not a take away and you don't have space for people to sit and relax I just struggle to see how you will compete with the likes of Wellington for city centre business.  I do however wish them luck.   N.B. for business owner: tell your staff to get off their mobile phones in front of customers its not very professional especially when its in front of you.

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Logo is cool

bBW48f9wtFMkEGdts-CYPw.text: The best coffee in my entire life. I drink at least three coffees per day. I tried various coffee shops around the world including the North America, European countries, and Asian countries. I could not find a coffee tasting like a coffee I had at the Milkman. I visited this shop about a year ago, my wife and I often talk about the Milkman when we talk about Edinburgh and coffee.

a_Qy4QvPMBNucNqeAyIyTg.text: Great coffee. If you're Aussie and are stinging for a proper flat white look no further. Staff are amazingly friendly with a small but tasty selection of pastries (incl. gluten free).  I could almost have been in Newtown.

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

6-rJWGMHGyJLusWK0svZrw.text: Nice little spot for a coffee. Not far from other stuff as well and close to the Hotel Motel One.

FARaE1dMWsd0LY8Cs6NyZg.text: Excellent coffeehouse at the edge of Old and New Towns. Very limited seating, but interesting space.

EtsaFJ4QB8Os4KPbTFaBcA.text: Nice place, great music, friendly people, good service and delicious coffee. Perfect place for a very good non Starbucks-Coffee!

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

1Q4uenK2Zvaq7EyVKeZrjQ.text: Love it! Cozy little artisan coffee and tea shop tucked in-between a line of shops, across the street from a steep staircase leading away from The Royal Mile. It reminds me of the hipster specialty coffee roasters in Midtown Sacramento (home in the US). I ordered a mocha, my husband ordered a latte, and we split a scone. All were divine! What I love about the mocha is that the dark, bitter chocolate makes for a more subtle flavor (not sweet), and it collects in small bits at the bottom of the mug (so I enjoyed scooping it up with a small spoon at the end). The coffee art on the latte and mocha were beautifully crafted. The scone was a bit crumbly and also moist, which I was pleasantly surprised by (most scones I've tried have had a drier texture). The Milkman sells chocolates, which look like mini peanut butter cups, in a jar by the register for 1 pound each -- SO WORTH IT -- These rich, dark chocolates are filled with peanut butter and caramel and sea salt is sprinkled on top. I loved the vibe and tastes of this place so much that I insisted we return the following day (and am so glad we did)! The baristas are friendly and chill. The indoor seating is rather limited (only a handful of places to sit) and there are a few chairs outside, but of course no one sits there when it's raining (which seems to happen somewhat often around here). Luckily, we stopped in when it wasn't busy and had our choice of indoor seating. I definitely recommend this place and would love to return yet another time if it works out during our short time left in Edinburgh!

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mocha

QPttyV7Ar0UA21l2WhRGtg.text: Best latte I've had in Edinburgh, amazing service, and it's a really cute little place too!

f_c5HJXQdsc1aP0z_i7LLQ.text: This is a great coffee shop. It's a bit small, but the quality is spot on. The staff are super friendly, the coffee is very high quality, and the music was good when we were in. Would definitely recommend if you're looking for a fancy hipster pick-me-up.

6tHb1DmaCsxYZoQ0An-K8w.text: Baby it's cold outside and I really need a nice cuppa warmth.   After seeing this pop up on my Instagram feed it was on my list of new coffee places to try.   And I'm glad I brought a good friend with me to share this beautiful moment of excellent flat white skills.  But first, I'll try and give you a picture of what it is like inside.   It's pretty cosy - say 10 seats at most and would potentially fill up quickly. It's very rustic but has a trendy vide too. The background music is quite chilling and not too loud if you were trying to have a conversation. The staff are super nice and a have a dab hand at doing latte art too.  Now the flat white. So let's get down to business ... So creamy and smooth and my friend agreed wholeheartedly also.   There are pastries and cakes too but I was too full from lunch.   But I did have room for one more super smooth flat white to help me bounce all the way home :)

NTr25b_c86e0Kmf9zsZFOg.text: Really cute little coffee shop at the bottom of Warriston's Close where everyone goes to wait out the opening of Real Mary King's Close. The coffee was great, the pastries were good, and the service was excellent. The girls were very friendly and didn't mind that we just hung out without constantly putting in orders.

mkCMnWUs-oKI2M9ctibvgw.text: Popped in for a flat white before work & it was really good.  This cafe is small & well designed & seems to be really catching on to a great trend of nice little cafes in Edinburgh.  not much space for a sit down coffee if you are planning on visiting with friends but as a takeaway option it is great.

3r5RC0IZF_EDE9lj9Cj9bg.text: Small coffee shop in the bottom of advocate's close. The coffee, tea, scones and croissant were pretty good. The space inside is small so if you are here during winter watch where you put your jackets b/c there is very little space especially if it's busy you can't put it anywhere and you just have to wear it while you drink your coffee or tea.

dUdJliF-ahp_ZJDv-RTGTg.text: Lovely little space, beautifully done up old and new, stone walls and third wave coffee- friendly service, great coffee, and lovely shortbread :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Almond croissant, shortbread and a Capp

9pT3l_eK5p0Bk7jiorGM4A.text: The best coffee, loose leaf tea and service in all of Edinburgh. If you enjoy a great cup of heaven then this is the place for you. As you're walking around in Old Town DO NOT pass by this incredible place without purchasing a cup.   Follow us on Instagram to view our travels @LIVING_TO_TRAVEL

otOpMzpsbJ132J50KZxd-g.text: Been here twice now, and each time has been lovely! Really reaalllly good coffee and friendly baristas. I've had my coffee to go both times, but the interior of the cafe is stylish and welcoming, even though it is small. Definitely a great place to pop in and get a caffeine boost before heading out to new town.

iR5sR8srUhLR9Uoc8GZwjg.text: Great coffee and super friendly staff! Shame there are not a load of food options (pastries and cakes only). Cosy spot and close to the station. Highly recommend for a coffee!

whoPZcjUmk8eb-ArLSpwRQ.text: Very reasonable prices, great music, perfect decor.  Hidden gem in the city of Edinburgh.  They have great outdoor seating and lots of live plants inside.  The staff is very kind and they have water as any good coffee shop should ;)  Highly recommend if you're in the market for a great place to work, read, chat or just sip some caffeine and relax

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Turmeric latte and flat white
Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Counter

kRteRVC3HPIfgDjGaGanbg.text: Best coffee this side of town, either takeaway or sitting in, and save room for a shortbread cookie or other dessert as well.   If you're on the High street, just cut through Advocates Close, which lets out right in front of the shop.  The staff are super friendly and quick. Just be aware that shop is small, so you'll be lucky to find a table on busy days. If you're looking for a place to sit down, this may not be it.

ANv_k7wA9Sqz3SrWItoBgg.text: Stopped in here first thing after spending a week in London. The coffee here is better than any I had in London. Perfectly nutty and delicious flavor -- they even warmed up the oat milk on the sude. Super cozy spot near the train/bus station with great people watching. Pastries looked delicious as well.

40nVx_SUfhvXtC8y-o7LdQ.text: The Milkman in two words? COZY GOODNESS! I loved popping into this cafe and feeling warm head to toe inside and out! The coffee and tea was a delight and the cakes were just as yummy! My party and I had been looking for a quick place to get warm and stumbled upon the Milkman, since it was close to closing we initially felt bad because the staff was cleaning up. To my surprise they stopped all they were doing and helped us even when we couldn't decide which treat we wanted! I was very appreciative of their patience and we were thrilled by the taste of the coffee and cakes! When back in Edinburgh I will be putting the Milkman on my cafe musts!

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

prVHW_oKIoUE-gC-eM8Bnw.text: Came here after arriving via bus to City Centre from the airport one cloudy morning. We couldn't drop our bags at the house yet so it was very nice to be able to come here without getting nay gripe from the baristas for having a suitcase.  The latte was fantastic and beautifully made. I loved the decor - chill vibe and eclectic style. It's a small shop but feels cozy. I had a cinnamon bun that was yeasty and delicious - fresh a couple hours earlier i am sure. Highly recommended!

l94tFoj9z0gEvcTMllN2AQ.text: Had a wonderful experience here! Located right off of Royal Mile, the Milkman has fine house-roasted coffee and plenty of pastries... many of which are Gluten Free.  The atmosphere is great and people working here are very friendly. Small shop, but the stone walls give it a very cozy, historic feel. Definitely a place to stop if you are picky about your coffee while in Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Gluten Free Pastries!

AKfI-VG9v9nbI6-vq9Rqpw.text: Small on space, big on taste.  Really great little shop at the end of Cockburn.   The cappuccino was top, didn't require any extra addings on my part.   Excited that I was (finally) able to source some gluten free pastries: the salted caramel brownie.  The texture was more than favorable for gluten free and the flavour excellent.   Prices fair for quality as 2 coffees and 3 pastries ran 14.   Small space surrounding inside. provides about 6-8, maybe 10 seats. Two tables are outside when the weather is fair.   Milkman came highly recommended and didn't disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cheeky shade.
Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Small inside with a little bit of seating outside.

ewg9CvI8JpUQNAfWoA8HLA.text: The cutest little coffee bar! The pastries were delicious, though they would be better warmed up. And the drinks are also delightful. A perfect wake me up to start the day.

gJ6W0wCrzYJHp5COq8rlbA.text: The coffee's decent, the service is OK. It gets really crowded, and doesn't seem to have a bathroom.

yi_Z8tqhp5b-zuWPEkPI_w.text: Delicious coffee, so so so good! Top 5 for sure. Buuuut expensive for the size of a regular coffee cup and service was slow because of how small it is.

DPdRwrjn6wpBEG9LYZyk3Q.text: A great spot for a cop of coffee and some baked goods!  We stopped here in the morning for a cup of coffee and some baked goods. Delicious and fresh! Between us we had a wonderful scone and chocolate croissant as well as cafe americano and cappuccino. All of it was excellent. The shop is relatively small, with both inside and outside seating. It was wonderful for a couple, harder for a large group.

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Cappuccino and a scone.
Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The counter and menu.

ltwquyQxUc9NMWVdiuW0qw.text: Best coffee I've had in Scotland.  If you're used to Australian/NewZealand style coffee shops. (With that perfect textured flat white) this is my gift to you.  My only regret is I didn't find it till my last day in Edinburgh.

Cijl5eNGUHmUgX_HbSo2zA.text: This cafe has really, really good coffee. I normally sweeten my coffee but this time I didn't cause it was that good on its own. The interior is very small with limited seating - because of its location, centrally located in Old Town, it also gets lots of visitors. But it  has a cozy vibe if you're lucky to get a seat and just chill. It's also dog friendly!

DWq4rRX_4I3d0ajJ6KIACA.text: Fantastic coffee and delicious cakes, always a great idea to stop by here. There are only a few tables and chairs so it gets pretty cosy inside, but it's lovely to take your time and watch the world go by on Cockburn St outside if you get the chance! Always order the Carrot Cake if it's available.

hzvtLyajGg-ppQCZBXVcrg.text: Going to local, independent businesses is important to us when we travel. So searching for a local coffee shop brought us to the Milkman. It was a Tuesday morning around 10:30. There were some people at the tables out front, and some inside. It appeared to be a mix of local business people and students. It seemed like we were the only tourists, which quite frankly, I loved.   The ambiance is delightful with old stone walls and charming decor.   The man and woman working there welcomed us warmly. Good people can make or break a place for me, and these people were friendly, helpful, and efficient.  I got a mocha. Delicious. My friend couldn't decide, so they recommended the Cloud Catcher tea. When it cooled down enough to drink, haha, it was quite tasty. Fruity but natural flavor, not the cloying, sweet artificial fruitiness. They do have food that looked really good, but as we didn't eat we can't vouch for it.  Though it appeared to be mostly locals as patrons, it is in a great location for travelers... close to Waverly station, or easy access from High Street via one of a few closes, or just down the hill of Cockburn St.  We enjoyed it so much we went back the following morning. And we will go back again, next time we're in Edinburgh.

lenazoayfmumeJg-9Purfg.text: If you are looking for good coffee in Edinburgh, this small cafe will not disappoint.  Cakes look pretty good too and service is super-friendly.  Not certain why I didn't  give five stars!

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

DnYes2mlpnbiVPom7lezfg.text: We went to Edinburgh for our first trip since moving to London. I love coffee as much as the next American, and love artisanal coffee shops as much as the next Brooklyn hipster. Luckily, this gem was located just down the hill from our Airbnb (shout out to Andrew, the best hockey-loving, Scottish Airbnb host)  When I visit somewhere new, I like to try a different coffee shop every morning. Out of the 3 we tried in Edinburgh, this was by far my favorite. Ordered the latte and a  breakfast version of a Cranachan. Both solid choices.  Best Part? The historic storefront is absolutely adorable (dare I say, instagram-worthy).  It's cozy (aka small with a few chairs) on the inside but doesn't seem to get too crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Adorable storefront! IG for our travel adventures: @helloandcheerio

pPbLTBggkboOy5FBw79xsA.text: Small place with a great selection of eats. They only have a few seats. Wifi available with a password. The coffee was excellent :) They now have debit.  Well worth checking out.

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Delicious
Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Temptation Temptation :)

O792ozfaq5UjMihe7ut4FA.text: The Milkman was a great place for breakfast. It's located right off the Royal Mile. Definitely reminiscent of the hipster coffee establishment back in the states. The staff were really friendly and helpful. I ordered a filter coffee and an almond croissant. This was the best filter coffee I had while in Edinburgh. It actually tasked like coffee! The croissant was very good with just the right amount of sugar. If you are in Edinburgh and need a great place for a coffee you should definitely seek out The Milkman.

photos.caption: Photo of The Milkman - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Filter coffee and almond croissant

BikL113Pl_3UbfgPe2umjA.text: This was probably the highlight of my day here in Edinburgh! Good coffee and pastries! Small and cozy place where you can have a good time with a nice view! Not a huge variety of pastries they change them often, probably just two or three kinds. But it's okay since every single one is really tasty
